title: Comparison with the Greater Than Or Equal To Operator

challengeFiles.name: script

solutions.name: script

tests.text: testGreaterOrEqual(10) should return the string 10 or Over
testGreaterOrEqual(11) should return the string 10 or Over
testGreaterOrEqual(19) should return the string 10 or Over
testGreaterOrEqual(100) should return the string 20 or Over
testGreaterOrEqual(21) should return the string 20 or Over
You should use the >= operator at least twice

description:
The greater than or equal to operator (>=) compares the values of two numbers. If the number to the left is greater than or equal to the number to the right, it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

Like the equality operator, the greater than or equal to operator will convert data types while comparing.

Examples

6   >=  6  // true
7   >= '3' // true
2   >=  3  // false
'7' >=  9  // false
instructions: Add the greater than or equal to operator to the indicated lines so that the return statements make sense.
